meanings.definition: Remove from the position of a priest or minister.
meanings.sent1: The bishop unfrocked the priest for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent2: The church unfrocked the minister due to misconduct.
meanings.sent3: The unfrocked priest decided to open a bakery instead.
meanings.sent4: Being unfrocked felt like losing a part of his identity.
meanings.sent5: The act of unfrocking was a solemn and irreversible decision.

meanings.definition: Deprived of the status or privileges of a priest or minister.
meanings.sent1: The unfrocked pastor found solace in gardening.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed being unfrocked in front of the congregation.
meanings.sent3: The unfrocked clergyman started a new career as a writer.
meanings.sent4: His unfrocked status made him feel like an outsider in his own community.
meanings.sent5: The unfrocked priest wore regular clothes for the first time in years.
